message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of finding sparse representations of signals using linear combinations of basis atoms, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. The paper also uses the geometry of convex polytopes to explore the optimality conditions for sparse representations, which suggests a connection to computational geometry (cs.CG) and discrete mathematics (cs.DS). The use of LP techniques and modern optimization methods suggests a connection to numerical analysis (cs.NA), while the focus on sparse representations and signal processing suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT).
